newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM climbs on Q1 EPS.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM climbs on Q1 EPS.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp share traded sharply higher in U.S. pre-open trade Thursday after last night's news of strong quarterly results renewed investor appeal, traders said.
In early third market trading, IBM shares climbed to 148 from 142-3/8 at Wednesday's New York Stock Exchange close.
The company announced after the close first quarter operating earnings of $2.37 per share, above the First Call consensus estimate of $2.28 per share and the $2.21 posted one year ago.
A series of brokerage upgrades followed the results.
A strong earnings report also buoyed Netscape Communications Corp stock, which rose one to 29-1/2 after the company announced a 119 percent climb in first-quarter profits.
Netscape reported earnings of $0.09 per share for the period, $0.01 above the consensus analysts' forecast and up from $0.04 per share netted one year ago.

U.S. Robotics Corp was another technology issue rallying before the market open, trading at 49-1/4 from 47 at last night's Nasdaq regular-session close and 1-1/4 better from Wednesday after-hours trading.

Late yesterday, the company reported fiscal second quarter earnings of $0.77 per share excluding a one-time gain, $0.02 above the Wall Street consensus view and better than the $0.55 per share earned one year ago.
U.S. Robotics's merger partner 3Com Corp also climbed, to 28-7/8 from 27-1/2.
The companies announced their merger agreement in February.
